description: Numbers n with an even number of digits, n = d_1 d_2 ... d_n, such that there are exactly three ways to partition the digits into two groups of size n/2, say f_1 ... f_{n/2} and g_1 ... g_{n/2}, such that n = f_1 ... f_{n/2} * g_1 ... g_{n/2}.
comments: f_{n/2} and g_{n/2} may not both be zero.Vampire numbers (definition 2) having exactly three distinct pairs of fangs.
references: C. A. Pickover, "Vampire Numbers." Ch. 30 in Keys to Infinity. New York: Wiley, pp. 227-231, 1995.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Vampire Number.
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: More terms found by Walter Schneider, Feb 11 2002 and communicated by _Hans Havermann_, Oct 10 2002
More terms from _Jens Kruse Andersen_, Dec 01 2002
